content:
TURLOCKWarriors baseball began their season against Western Oregon this weekend by loosing their first series of the season with a win Friday  and a doubleheader loss on Saturday   PERIOD

The series started off strong going into an extra inning with a standout performance from seniors second baseman Justin Charles as well as pitcher Bryan Lemon who received the win for Stanislaus PERIOD

Lemon had a strong performance pitching six and twothirds innings PERIOD Charles had a sacrifice fly two RBIs including the game winning RBI occurring in the bottom of the tenth inning and scored a run in the bottom of the third PERIOD

We came out energized and played good as a team and were excited to get the big win said Charles PERIOD

Both of the Saturdays games resulted in a loss for the Warriors PERIOD Though the Warriors suffered a loss in game two senior starting pitcher Rafael Vasquez pitched into the eighth inning only giving up one earned run and six hits while striking out five batters PERIOD Senior centerfielder Craig Beevers contributed with two hits PERIOD

The last game of the series started off shaky as the Warriors were down  until the bottom of the seventh inning when four runs were scored to tie up the game with the Wolves scoring the final run in the top of the ninth PERIOD Sophomore third baseman Skippy Ferreria juniors catcher Andrew Graves and shortstop Matt Chaidez each had a run in the bottom of the seventh PERIOD

Stanislauss next series is this weekend Friday at Fresno Pacific and Saturday at home with first pitch at 2p.m PERIOD
